intro: Minuartia helmii, commonly known as the helms' sandwort, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white or pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, cold environments. Its leaves are usually linear and closely arranged, forming a dense, low-growing structure. Minuartia helmii is often found in tundra and mountainous areas across the northern hemisphere.
